alert.note: Alert for Crockett (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS San Angelo (Central Texas San Angelo)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 18 at 3:18PM CDT by NWS San Angelo
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact western portions of Crockett County through 415 PM CDT... At 316 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a cluster of strong thunderstorms from near Sheffield to southwestern Crockett County moving northeast at 10 to 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph and nickel size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... The Intersection Of Ranch Road 2083 And Highway 405, Ft Lancaster, The Intersection Of I-10 And Highway 405, The Intersection Of I-10 And Highway 290 and I-10 Near The Crockett-Pecos County Line. This includes Interstate 10 between Mile Markers 327 and 362. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.88 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
